text: hi my name is kelly griffin and i'm a
solution architect with aws
today i'm going to provide you with a
quick overview of the fsx
file gateway so let's jump right in
the aws storage gateway acts as a bridge
to provide access to virtually unlimited
cloud storage
by connecting cloud applications running
on premises
to amazon storage the storage gateway
allows customers to connect to
and use key cloud storage services such
as amazon s3
amazon s3 glacier amazon fsx for windows
file server
and amazon elastic block store the
storage gateway
easily deploys on-premises as a
pre-configured hardware appliance
or there's also virtual machine options
that support
all major hypervisors by providing a
local cache
storage gateway enables low latency
access to frequently accessed data
the storage gateway supports access via
standard storage protocols
such as nfs smb and iscsi vtl
so no changes to customers applications
are required
data is transferred securely and
efficiently between the on-premises
environment
and aws there are four different
types of gateways customers use the s3
file gateway to store file data into s3
for use by
object-based workloads including data
analytics
machine learning or as a cost effective
storage target for backups
and as a repository or tier in the cloud
for application file storage
the fsx file gateway provides low
latency access
to amazon fsx for windows file server
data
on premise making it easy for users to
access
fsx for windows file server data while
conserving shared bandwidth
customers use tape gateway to replace
existing physical tape libraries
with a virtual tape library or a vtl
you can continue to use your existing
backup applications and workflows
while writing to a nearly limitless
collection of virtual tapes
and each virtual tape is stored in
amazon s3
where it can be stored for long term
requirements
the volume gateway presents your
application's block
storage volumes using the iscsi protocol
and data written to these volumes can be
asynchronously backed up
as point in time snapshots of your data
and stored in the cloud as amazon ebs
snapshots
[Music]
and customers are looking to replace
file share infrastructure
but they have challenges with high
latency and limited network bandwidth
issues
an fsx file gateway simplifies file
storage
in amazon fsx for windows file server
providing existing applications access
to windows shares
as a cost-effective alternative to an
on-premises storage
it also provides low latency access to
data through transparent local caching
this provides customers with a path to
leverage a cloud managed file server
on-prem
as a replacement of their nas or file
server
as well as enabling native aws cloud
services
such as out-of-band backup with aws
backup
with these capabilities customers can
consolidate
all of their on-prem file share data in
aws
on fsx for windows file server and
benefit from protected
resilient and fully managed file systems
so let's have a look at the
demonstration on using the fsx file
gateway
so here we are in the console and we've
got
our new gateway here which is an amazon
fsx
file gateway you can see the different
platforms here that we have a
have choice now i've got an amazon
ec2 appliance already set up in the
background
so we're going to leverage that
you can choose your different service
endpoint for our demonstration purposes
we're going to choose public and we'll
go over
here to our gateway demo
device that we've already set up in the
previous
environment we'll apply the public ip
address of that
click next
we now have just a couple of additional
settings that we need to do
such as time zone and give it a name we
can also associate any tags that we'd
like to do so
but you can also do them later on as
well so we'll scroll down and we'll
activate the gateway
i'll attach some disks to it that's our
cache that's going to be on premise
we'll associate it to a new log group
and we're done
so now that's in a running state
so we've now got our fsx gateway ready
to go
and we'll attach our
gateway to it you can now also associate
any
active directory domain settings that
you like and this in is
in line with what we've already got for
an amazon fsx
file server
so you can see our file gateway there
and that's all of the additional
settings so you can have a look in the
cloudwatch logs
have a look at some metrics as well
through cloudwatch metrics
so if we have a look at our ip address
here
so you can see here i've got
representation
of an on-premises environment
and i've also got an fsx windows file
server here
so up the top i'm connecting to our
fsx file gateway and down the bottom
there i'm connecting to
an fsx windows file server so what we're
going to have a look at now
is the difference in latency so
accessing a file through the
fsx gateway and also accessing a file
through our amazon fsx windows file
server
and as you can see here just opening up
100 records
pretty much the same type of speed now
what happens though
if we access a few more files
so we'll now open up a file that's got
approximately 1 million records in it
and you can see that that took
approximately 13 seconds to get it
from our amazon fsx windows file server
inside the aws cloud now let's open up
the same
file utilizing our fsx
gateway you can see there's a massive
difference there of approximately 12
seconds
or thereabouts to open up a file and on
cache
now again if we do the same thing with a
much larger file we'll just speed this
up
so that took approximately 49 seconds
now if we do exactly the same thing
again
with the same file using our fsx gateway
we won't need to speed this one up
because it's going to be considerably
faster
so you can see how much of a difference
it is to access that same file
using the cache via the fsx
gateway
